ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to improve my writing with several writing strategies and formats.
In general, I learned a lot about how to improve my writing and how to write an academic paper.

I gained much better insight on my style of writing and the points in my writing that I need to improve. I also learned how to effectively keep my argument present throughout my writing and not just at the beginning or end.
I improved my writing skills
This class helped me develop my analysis skills through writing and through asking/answering questions in a group setting.
I learned how to write research papers and write my own interpretation of several papers.
Essay writing skills and literary analysis skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The instructor of this course was super kind and accommodating, and I never really felt stressed about the workload or assignments when taking this course. The material that we covered was genuinely interesting, though I wish that the in-class discussions were a bit more active.
The three writing assignments really allowed for improvement throughout the semester. The readings were engaging and allowed for many interesting discussion to occur.
The material was varied and interesting, but still unified. I found my classmates to be very insightful and the professor guided the discussions very capably.

The prof did a wonderful job making everyone feel very comfortable in the class. There was no pressure to have to speak, but I think everyone felt comfortable enough to contribute and engage in discussions.
I really enjoyed the essay topics

This course was very interesting which made it easy to give the class a lot of attention. I enjoyed the seminar format and the smaller break out rooms, which allowed me to learn from my classmates and consider other points of view. I also really enjoyed the media that we interacted with.
I think the course was taught very well altogether.
A strength is that it was very understandable and manageable. A weakness is that it was sometimes a little repetitive.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If any changes were made, they were very successful. The class was engaging, and the teacher provided a fun learning environment where feedback was readily given.
The flexibility of deadlines really helped me produce my best possible work, and it helped reduce the amount of burnout I experienced later in the semester.
The practices were successful, especially the breakout rooms that allowed for more in depth discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. Professor Siegel is one of the nicest professors I've ever met. She is incredibly accommodating and understanding, and she provides very useful feedback on essays as well. She holds many office hours and is very open to meeting up with students to discuss improvements or concerns.
Yes, it's a great introduction to writing at a college level, and the material in this course was super accessible and interesting to read.

I would definitely recommend this course. English 114 is a great was to get writing experience in and this particular topic was so exciting. I've always loved puzzles and mysteries and this course brought me those topics and expanded on them. It really was a great experience and I would definitely tell people to take this course.
I would highly recommend the course. I was expecting to just knock out a requirement, but ended up really enjoying the material we studied and having a sustained interest in it.
YES! Micah is the BEST!!!
Yes! Professor is amazing and subject matter is also very interesting. Liked to low pressure environment and thought it helped me to better engage with the course comfortably and meaningfully
Yes. I really enjoyed learning in this class. The material was interesting, and I feel like I was able to practice my writing and analysis skills.
I would definitely recommend this course. The content was always very intriguing and Micah gave us great feedback and working shops to improve our writing skills.

I would recommend this because it was very interesting and even though I do not usually like English classes, it was taught in a way that kept me engaged and allowed me to develop the skills that were intended to be taught.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: No other modes.
None
Just virtual seminar
